intro: Moraea palmifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Moraea palmifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
